children.name: AccommodationFacility
children.label: Accommodation facility
children.description: A building or collection of buildings without a singular purpose, but generally used for accommodation.

children.name: Apartment building
children.label: Apartment building
children.description: Accommodation facility consisting of a multi-dwelling residential building divided into separate units.

children.name: Building
children.label: Building
children.description: Accommodation facility represented generically as a building used for lodging.

children.name: Camp
children.label: Camp
children.description: Accommodation facility formed by a group of temporary or semi-permanent shelters for people.

children.name: Compound
children.label: Compound
children.description: Accommodation facility comprising multiple buildings or units within a bounded enclosure.

children.name: House
children.label: House
children.description: Accommodation facility that is a single-family dwelling or similar standalone residence.

children.name: Hut
children.label: Hut
children.description: Accommodation facility that is a small and simple shelter or dwelling.

children.name: Row house
children.label: Row house
children.description: Accommodation facility comprising a dwelling attached in a row to adjacent similar dwellings.

children.name: Shed
children.label: Shed
children.description: Accommodation facility represented as a simple outbuilding or shelter used for lodging/storage.

children.name: Unit of accommodation
children.label: Unit of accommodation
children.description: Accommodation facility denoting an individual lodging unit (e.g., apartment, room, module) within a larger site.

children.name: Facility
children.label: Facility
children.description: Base facility category

children.name: Action
children.label: Action
children.description: An activity, or the occurrence of an activity, that may utilise resources and may be focused against an objective.

children.name: Actor
children.label: Actor
children.description: Base actor category

children.name: Object
children.label: Object
children.description: An individually identified object that has military or civilian significance.
children.info:
This can range from a unit to a single person, an entire tank to a single bolt, and a mountain to a pile of dirt. Objects may not only be physical objects but also intangible or abstract objects such as rendezvous points, phase lines, and boundaries.
Class Object is non-abstract to support tracking situations where, initially, the object being tracked cannot be definitively classified.

children.name: Agriculture facility
children.label: Agriculture facility
children.description: A facility related to farming, including cultivation of the soil for the growing of crops and the rearing of animals to provide food, wool, and other products.

children.name: Cropland
children.label: cropland
children.description: An area that has been tilled for the planting of crops.

children.name: Farm
children.label: farm
children.description: A tract of land, including buildings and structures, whose primary use is the production of food (for example: crops or livestock).

children.name: Orchard
children.label: orchard
children.description: A tract covered by systematic plantings of trees that yield fruits (including nuts).

children.name: Military facility
children.label: Military facility
children.description: A facility designed to support services that can be found only in the military and have no civilian equivalent.

children.name: Air defence radar site
children.label: Air defence radar site
children.description: Military facility hosting air-defence radar systems for airspace surveillance and control.

children.name: Airborne early warning ground facility
children.label: Airborne early warning ground facility
children.description: Ground facility supporting airborne early-warning (AEW) missions (support, control, maintenance).

children.name: Army military base or facility
children.label: Army military base or facility
children.description: Army installation used for accommodation, training, logistics, or command.

children.name: Artillery locating site
children.label: Artillery locating site
children.description: Facility where artillery-locating sensors or systems are deployed.

children.name: Barracks
children.label: Barracks
children.description: Military accommodation facility for personnel and unit support.

children.name: Bivouac
children.label: Bivouac
children.description: Temporary encampment area for troops in the field.

children.name: Electronic warfare site
children.label: Electronic warfare site
children.description: Facility supporting electronic warfare operations (EA/EP/ES).

children.name: Fortification
children.label: Fortification
children.description: Military defensive works designed to strengthen a position against attack.

children.name: Forward operating base
children.label: Forward operating base
children.description: Forward-deployed base supporting operations closer to the area of interest.

children.name: Ground surveillance radar site
children.label: Ground surveillance radar site
children.description: Facility hosting ground-surveillance radar for movement detection and situational awareness.

children.name: Logistics or supply facility
children.label: Logistics or supply facility
children.description: Facility for sustainment, storage, or distribution of military supplies.

children.name: Military base or facility
children.label: Military base or facility
children.description: Generic military installation supporting accommodation, operations, training, or command.

children.name: Military bridging site
children.label: Military bridging site
children.description: Site used for emplacement or operation of military bridging equipment.

children.name: Military obstacle
children.label: Military obstacle
children.description: Military obstacle employed to delay, disrupt, or channel movement.

children.name: Composed anti tank obstacle
children.label: Composed anti tank obstacle
children.description: Composite obstacle designed to counter armoured vehicles.

children.name: Ditch
children.label: Ditch
children.description: Linear excavation used as a military obstacle.

children.name: Minefield
children.label: Minefield
children.description: Area seeded with land or sea mines as an obstacle.

children.name: Other military obstacle
children.label: Other military obstacle
children.description: Other type of military obstacle not otherwise specified.

children.name: Wire obstacle
children.label: Wire obstacle
children.description: Obstacle constructed with wire (e.g., barbed or concertina) to slow or canalize movement.

children.name: Military seaport or naval base
children.label: Military seaport or naval base
children.description: Naval base or military seaport supporting maritime operations and logistics.

children.name: Missile site
children.label: Missile site
children.description: Facility for deployment, storage, or operation of missile systems.

children.name: Naval air station
children.label: Naval air station
children.description: Naval aviation base supporting maritime air operations.

children.name: Observation tower
children.label: Observation tower
children.description: Tower structure used for observation and surveillance.

children.name: Prisoner of war camp
children.label: Prisoner of war camp
children.description: Facility for detention of prisoners of war.

children.name: Sensor fusion post
children.label: Sensor fusion post
children.description: Facility where sensor data are integrated/fused to support situational awareness.

children.name: Shoran station
children.label: Shoran station
children.description: Short-range navigation (SHORAN) station facility.

children.name: Submarine military base or facility
children.label: Submarine military base or facility
children.description: Base or facility supporting submarine operations and sustainment.

children.name: Surface surveillance jammer
children.label: Surface surveillance jammer
children.description: Facility hosting systems to jam surface surveillance sensors.

children.name: Surface to surface missile site
children.label: Surface to surface missile site
children.description: Facility for deployment or operation of surface-to-surface missiles.

children.name: Tacan station
children.label: Tacan station
children.description: Tactical air navigation (TACAN) station facility.

children.name: Tactical intelligence centre
children.label: Tactical intelligence centre
children.description: Facility hosting tactical intelligence processing and dissemination.

children.name: Transport facility
children.label: Transport facility
children.description: A facility that is used to support transport functions.

children.name: Air transport facility
children.label: Air transport facility
children.description: A facility designed to aid or enable transport of goods or passengers in the air.

children.name: Airfield
children.label: Airfield
children.description: An area prepared for the accommodation (including buildings and installations) or equipment of landing and take-off of aircraft.

children.name: Airport or airbase
children.label: Airport or airbase
children.description: An air transport facility used for the landing and take-off of aircraft, including its buildings and installations.

children.name: Apron
children.label: Apron
children.description: A defined area on a land aerodrome intended to accommodate aircraft for the purposes of loading or unloading passengers, mail or cargo, fuelling, parking or maintenance.

children.name: Helipad
children.label: Helipad
children.description: A small, designated area (usually with a prepared surface) used for the take-off, landing, or parking of helicopters.

children.name: Heliport
children.label: Heliport
children.description: An aerodrome or defined area on a structure intended or used for the arrival, departure, and surface movement of helicopters.

children.name: Runway
children.label: Runway
children.description: A defined rectangular area on a land aerodrome prepared for the landing and take-off of aircraft.

children.name: General transport facility
children.label: General transport facility
children.description: A non-specific transport facility that supports general transport functions.

children.name: Ground transport facility
children.label: Ground transport facility
children.description: A facility designed to aid or enable transport of goods or passengers on land.

children.name: Cleared way
children.label: Cleared way
children.description: A route which has been cleared of obstacles to permit movement.

children.name: Crossing platform
children.label: Crossing platform
children.description: A facility enabling the crossing of a water obstacle or similar barrier.

children.name: Ford
children.label: Ford
children.description: A shallow place in a river or stream allowing one to walk or drive across.

children.name: Rail facility
children.label: Rail facility
children.description: A facility associated with the operation or support of railway transport.

children.name: Rail head
children.label: Rail head
children.description: The furthest point to which the railway has been laid from a particular direction, or a rail-served point designated for loading/unloading.

children.name: Railway
children.label: Railway
children.description: A permanent track composed of a line of parallel metal rails fixed to sleepers, for transport of passengers and goods in trains.

children.name: Railway crossing
children.label: Railway crossing
children.description: A place where a railway and a road, path, or another railway cross at the same level.

children.name: Railway junction
children.label: Railway junction
children.description: A place where two or more railway lines or routes meet or diverge.

children.name: Road
children.label: Road
children.description: A wide way leading from one place to another, especially one with a specially prepared surface which vehicles can use.

children.name: Road interchange
children.label: Road interchange
children.description: A road junction that typically uses grade separation, and one or more ramps, to permit traffic on at least one highway to pass through the junction without directly crossing any other traffic stream.

children.name: Trail
children.label: Trail
children.description: A beaten path or track through rough country such as a forest or moor, used for travel or transport on foot, horseback, or by vehicle.

children.name: Tunnel
children.label: Tunnel
children.description: An underground or underwater passage dug through the surrounding soil/earth/rock and enclosed except for entry and exit, commonly used for road and rail traffic.

children.name: Maritime transport facility
children.label: Maritime transport facility
children.description: A facility designed to aid or enable transport of goods or passengers by sea or inland waterways.

children.name: Anchorage
children.label: Anchorage
children.description: A place where a vessel may anchor, usually designated in charts, offering suitable holding ground and shelter.

children.name: Basin
children.label: Basin
children.description: A partially enclosed, man-made or improved water area providing safe anchorage and berthing for vessels.

children.name: Berth
children.label: Berth
children.description: A designated location in a port or harbour where a vessel may be moored, usually alongside a quay, pier, or jetty.

children.name: Dry dock
children.label: Dry dock
children.description: A dock from which water can be pumped out, for the construction, maintenance, and repair of ships.

children.name: Ferry or ford access
children.label: Ferry or ford access
children.description: An access point intended for embarkation/disembarkation for ferries or access to a ford crossing.

children.name: Ferry station
children.label: Ferry station
children.description: A station or terminal for ferries, including embarkation and disembarkation facilities for passengers and vehicles.

children.name: Harbour
children.label: Harbour
children.description: A sheltered area of water where ships, boats, and barges can be moored safely, often with port facilities.

children.name: Jetty
children.label: Jetty
children.description: A structure projecting from the shore into a body of water to influence current or tide or to protect a harbour; also used for mooring vessels.

children.name: Lighthouse
children.label: Lighthouse
children.description: A tower or other structure with a powerful light that gives a continuous or intermittent signal to navigators.

children.name: Lock
children.label: Lock
children.description: An enclosed section of waterway with gates at each end, by which the level of water can be altered to raise or lower vessels as they pass through.

children.name: Pier
children.label: Pier
children.description: A platform supported on pillars or girders leading out from the shore into a body of water, used as a landing stage for boats.

children.name: Port
children.label: Port
children.description: A town or city with a harbour where ships load or unload, especially one where customs officers are stationed.

children.name: Quay
children.label: Quay
children.description: A solidly constructed platform, usually parallel to the shore, where a vessel can be loaded or unloaded on one side of the vessel only.

children.name: Slipway
children.label: Slipway
children.description: The prepared and usually reinforced inclined plane upon which the keel blocks are laid for supporting a vessel under construction.

children.name: Aircraft
children.label: Aircraft
children.description: A Vehicle that is designed to fly within the earth's atmosphere.

children.name: Vehicle
children.label: Vehicle
children.description: A conveyance for transporting persons or things.

children.name: Control feature
children.label: Control feature
children.description: A non-tangible Feature of military interest that is administratively specified, may be represented by a geometric figure, and is associated with the conduct of military operations.
children.info: A ControlFeature is an abstract object created or assigned by military authorities for the purposes of planning and coordination, especially in operational areas. It is a non-permanent point (e.g., start point for a road move, or a reserved demolition), line (e.g., a Main supply route or No fire line), area (e.g., a Slow-go area), or volume (e.g., an air corridor) that may be overlaid on a map. A ControlFeature would normally be drawn on a map overlay, traced, or superimposed onto digitised map data and assigned a descriptive title, symbol, or name (e.g., Line of departure, Corps boundary).

children.name: Airspace control feature
children.source: MIM 5.3 (air control feature; orbit control feature; air route)
children.label: Airspace control feature
children.description: Control feature used to organise, enable, constrain, or deconflict air operations via routes, holds/orbits, and airspace volumes.
children.info: Decision & alignment: Consolidates MIM 'air control feature', 'orbit control feature', and 'air route' into a single operational class focused on air C2 and deconfliction. Rationale: in exercises these are governed together (ACO/ACA), share geometry types (line/area/volume) and attributes (altitude bands, timing, controlling authority). Specific doctrinal terms (e.g., CAP orbit) should be captured as instance categories rather than separate classes.

children.name: C2 boundary feature
children.label: C2 boundary feature
children.description: Control feature that delineates responsibilities, sectors, or areas of operation for command and control.
children.info: Decision & alignment: Groups MIM 'c2 control feature' and 'organisation boundary' as a single class because both express C2 delimitations (AOs, sectors, limits of responsibility). Rationale: operational semantics are identical (named boundary/area with authority, timeframe); the exact doctrinal label (e.g., corps boundary, AO, FLOT/FEBA) is modelled as an instance category.

children.name: CBRN control feature
children.label: CBRN control feature
children.description: Control feature defining CBRN-related areas, routes, or volumes for protection, decontamination, or hazard management.
children.info: Decision & alignment: Direct consolidation of MIM 'cbrn control feature'. Rationale: CBRN corridors, hazard areas, and decontamination zones share the same control semantics; the specific C/B/R/N modality and posture are instance attributes.

children.name: Fires coordination feature
children.label: Fires coordination feature
children.description: Control feature used to coordinate, permit, restrict, or deconflict fires and effects.
children.info: Decision & alignment: Mirrors MIM 'fires control feature' while keeping FSCMs (e.g., CFL, FSCL, RFA, NFA) as instance-level categories, avoiding a class per FSCM. Rationale: common semantics (named line/area, authority, effective time) are shared; only the doctrinal code differs.

children.name: Mobility / countermobility feature
children.source: MIM 5.3 (obstacle control feature; barrier; obstacle; obstacle bypass; obstacle free area; obstacle gap; obstacle lane; obstacle restricted area)
children.label: Mobility / countermobility feature
children.description: Control feature that enables or impedes movement by designating obstacles, lanes, gaps, free areas, or bypasses.
children.info: Decision & alignment: Consolidates MIM 'obstacle control feature' and its direct children (barrier, obstacle, bypass, free area, gap, lane, restricted area) into one class. Rationale: all are manoeuvre-control constructs with shared geometry and governance; the precise MIM subtype is retained as an instance category (e.g., 'obstacle lane'). Deeper subtypes (e.g., belts/zones) are intentionally not promoted to classes to keep the model compact.

children.name: Reference & navigation fix
children.source: MIM 5.3 (fix; acoustic fix; electromagnetic fix; optical fix)
children.label: Reference & navigation fix
children.description: Control feature acting as a reference for navigation, targeting, or coordination (point/line/area), including sensor-specific fixes.
children.info: Decision & alignment: Consolidates MIM 'fix' and its direct children (acoustic/electromagnetic/optical). Rationale: same control concept differentiated only by sensing modality; the modality is captured as an instance attribute rather than new classes.

children.name: Route control feature
children.source: MIM 5.3 (route; land route; maritime route; other route)
children.label: Route control feature
children.description: Control feature defining movement routes for forces or logistics across domains.
children.info: Decision & alignment: Consolidates MIM 'route' and its direct children (land, maritime, other) under a single class. Rationale: operational semantics are identical (named line/corridor with restrictions, flow, timing). Domain and role (e.g., MSR/ASR) are captured as instance attributes. Air routes are handled under Airspace control feature to keep all air C2 together.

children.name: Sustainment control feature
children.label: Sustainment control feature
children.description: Control feature used to designate sustainment corridors, areas, or nodes supporting logistics operations.
children.info: Decision & alignment: Direct alignment with MIM 'sustainment control feature'. Rationale: logistics control constructs are kept as one class; the exact doctrinal term (e.g., MSR, ASR) remains an instance category to avoid class proliferation.

children.name: Commercial facility
children.label: Commercial facility
children.description: A facility designed to enable or support commercial business processes.

children.name: Bank
children.label: Bank
children.description: An establishment where money is stored for saving or commercial purposes.

children.name: Market
children.label: Market
children.description: A facility where commercial activity is conducted and goods and services are bought and sold.

children.name: Office
children.label: Office
children.description: A place in which business, professional or clerical activities are conducted.

children.name: Shop
children.label: Shop
children.description: A small retail store or a speciality department in a large store.

children.name: Built up area
children.label: Built up area
children.description: A tract containing a concentration of buildings and/or other structures.

children.name: City
children.label: City
children.description: Facility representing a built-up area at city scale, typically with high population density and diverse administrative and economic functions.

children.name: Hamlet
children.label: Hamlet
children.description: Facility representing a very small built-up area or settlement, usually a few dwellings with minimal services.

children.name: Town
children.label: Town
children.description: Facility representing a medium-sized built-up area, larger than a village and smaller than a city, with local services and governance.

children.name: Urban Area
children.label: Urban Area
children.description: Facility representing a contiguous built environment comprising cities, towns, and suburbs with predominantly non-rural land use.

children.name: Village
children.label: Village
children.description: Facility representing a small built-up area or settlement, typically rural, with limited services.

children.name: Control measure
children.label: Control measure
children.description: A Facility that also denotes a ControlMeasure.

children.name: Cannibalization point
children.label: Cannibalization point
children.description: Facility/Control measure for removal of serviceable parts from equipment to restore other systems.
children.info: Equivalent to MIM 'Cannibalization Point'.

children.name: Casualty collection point
children.label: Casualty collection point
children.description: Facility/Control measure where casualties are gathered, triaged and prepared for evacuation to higher medical echelons.
children.info: Equivalent to MIM 'Casualty Collection Point' (CCP).

children.name: Decontamination facility
children.label: Decontamination facility
children.description: Facility/Control measure for CBRN decontamination operations.
children.info: Equivalent to MIM 'Decontamination Facility'.

children.name: Forward arming and refuelling point
children.source: MIM 5.3 (Forward Arming and Refuelling Point Facility)
children.label: Forward arming and refuelling point
children.description: Facility/Control measure for forward arming and refuelling of aviation assets (FARP).
children.info: Equivalent to MIM 'Forward Arming and Refuelling Point Facility' (FARP) for aviation sustainment.

children.name: Maintenance collection point
children.source: MIM 5.3 (Maintenance Collection Point; Unit Maintenance Collection Point)
children.label: Maintenance collection point
children.description: Facility/Control measure where equipment is collected for repair/maintenance; may include unit-level maintenance nodes.
children.info: Groups MIM 'Maintenance Collection Point' and 'Unit Maintenance Collection Point'.

children.name: Medical evacuation pickup point
children.label: Medical evacuation pickup point
children.description: Facility/Control measure serving as the designated point for MEDEVAC pickup (air/ground).
children.info: Equivalent to MIM 'Medical Evacuation Pickup Point' (MEDEVAC PP).

children.name: Observation post
children.source: MIM 5.3 (Observation Post; Reconnaissance Outpost; Sensor Outpost/Listening Post; Forward Observer Position; Combat Outpost; Dismounted CBRN Observation Post)
children.label: Observation post
children.description: Facility/Control measure where observation, surveillance or reconnaissance is conducted (observer, recon, sensor, combat, CBRN, etc.).
children.info: Consolidates MIM: Observation Post (OP), Reconnaissance Outpost, Sensor Outpost or Listening Post, Forward Observer Position, Combat Outpost, and Dismounted CBRN Observation Post.

children.name: Population handling area
children.source: MIM 5.3 (Detainee Collection/Holding; POW Collection/Holding; Civilian Collection; Refugee Holding)
children.label: Population handling area
children.description: Facility/Control measure for handling non-combatants and detainees (collection/holding) including POW, detainees, civilians, and refugees.
children.info: Consolidates MIM: Detainee Collection Point/Holding Area, Prisoner of War Collection Point/Holding Area, Civilian Collection Point, Refugee Holding Area.

children.name: Rearm refuel resupply point
children.label: Rearm refuel resupply point
children.description: Facility/Control measure for on-station rearm/refuel/resupply of ground units.
children.info: Equivalent to MIM 'Rearm Refuel and Resupply Point' for ground operations (on-station).

children.name: Refuel on the move point
children.label: Refuel on the move point
children.description: Facility/Control measure enabling refuel operations while the unit remains in movement through designated lanes.
children.info: Equivalent to MIM 'Refuel On the Move Point' (ROM); complements the on-station rearm/refuel point.

children.name: Supply distribution point
children.source: MIM 5.3 (Supply Point; Logistics Release Point; Ammunition Supply/Transfer Point; Trailer Transfer Point)
children.label: Supply distribution point
children.description: Facility/Control measure where classes of supply are issued or transferred to supported units (ammo, general supplies, LRP, trailer/transfer nodes).
children.info: Groups MIM: Supply Point, Logistics Release Point (LRP), Ammunition Supply Point (ASP), Ammunition Transfer Point (ATP), Trailer Transfer Point. Keep the fine term as an instance category if needed.

children.name: Support area
children.label: Support area
children.description: Facility/Control measure designating the area where sustainment functions are staged and executed for a formation.
children.info: Consolidates MIM 'Brigade Support Area', 'Division Support Area', and 'Regimental Support Area'. The echelon is carried as capability.

children.name: Traffic control post
children.label: Traffic control post
children.description: Facility/Control measure used to regulate movement along routes and control flows at critical nodes.
children.info: Equivalent to MIM 'Traffic Control Post' (TCP).

children.name: Engineering
children.label: Engineering capability
children.description:
A Capability, required for planning, of those Organisations and Persons that are deemed as having the ability to perform construction or destruction activities. This includes performing mobility and counter-mobility tasks. 

Remarks:

EngineeringCapability provides additional information concerning the conditions for which the engineering capability is defined, that is, the type of facility which is being constructed or destroyed (or in the case of obstacles, breached) as well as the dimensions of that facility. Engineering capabilities can be described for different echelon levels. For instance, a bridge-building platoon may be capable of either constructing two bridges, each 20 metres long, or a single bridge that is 40 metres long. A company that is made up of three platoons may therefore be capable of building a single bridge that is 120 metres long. The first capability can be described at platoon level, the second at company level.

children.name: Fire
children.label: Fire capability
children.description:
A Capability, required for planning, of those Facilities, Equipment, Organisations and Persons that are deemed as having the ability to discharge or launch a projectile or missile. 

Remarks:

FireCapability provides additional information about the type of projectile, which is being discharged or launched.

children.name: Handling
children.label: Handling capability
children.description: A Capability, required for planning, of those Facilities and Equipment that are deemed as having the ability to move Materiel (raw materials, scrap, semi-finished, and finished) to, through, and from productive processes; in warehouses and storage; and in receiving and shipping areas.

children.name: Maintenance
children.label: Maintenance capability
children.description: A Capability, required for planning, of those Facilities, Equipment, Organisations and Persons that are deemed as having the ability to provide a range of activities required to restore or maintain operational usage.

children.name: Mobility
children.label: Mobility capability
children.description:
A Capability, required for planning, of those Facilities, Materiel, Organisations and Persons that are deemed as having the nominal ability to move in space, air, on water, under water, or over a specific type of terrain. 

Remarks:

MobilityCapability specifies additional information about the kind of mobility and, in certain cases, the conditions for which the manoeuvre capability is defined, in particular, the type of terrain that is being traversed.

children.name: Operational
children.label: Operational capability
children.description:
A Capability, required for planning, of those Objects that are deemed as having the ability, the training and the equipment to perform an operation.

Remarks:

OperationalCapability permits operational roles to be assigned to units or types of units, or in addition to the roles that are inherent in the typing of units.

children.name: Storage
children.label: Storage capability
children.description: A Capability, required for planning, of those Facilities and Equipment that are deemed as having the ability to hold a specific type of Object.

children.name: Support
children.label: Support capability
children.description: A Capability, required for planning, of those Facilities, Equipment, Persons and Organisations that are deemed as having the ability to provide supplies or services.

children.name: Transmission
children.label: Transmission capability
children.description: A Capability, required for planning, of that Materiel that is deemed as having the ability to generate, receive or affect signals in the electromagnetic spectrum.

children.name: Civilian
children.label: Civilian
children.description: A person who is not a member of the armed forces or other organized armed groups; generally protected from direct attack under the law of armed conflict.

children.name: Person
children.label: Person
children.description: A human being of military or civilian significance.

children.name: Group organisation
children.label: Group organisation
children.description: An Organisation that is non-formal in nature and classes together its members due to mutual or common circumstances.

children.name: Civilian convoy
children.label: Civilian convoy
children.description: A group of vehicles organised for the purpose of control and orderly movement.

children.name: Media group
children.label: Media group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons that report for mass communications (especially television, radio, and newspapers).

children.name: International media group
children.label: International media group
children.description: A MediaGroup that comprises persons that report for international mass communications, but do not take part in the actions.

children.name: Local media group
children.label: Local media group
children.description: A MediaGroup that comprises persons that report for local mass communications, but do not take part in the actions.

children.name: National media group
children.label: National media group
children.description: A MediaGroup that comprises persons that report for national mass communications, but do not take part in the actions.

children.name: Other group organisation
children.label: Other group organisation
children.description: A GroupOrganisation for which no further information is given other than its category.

children.name: Contractor group
children.label: Contractor group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that contracts or undertakes to supply certain articles, or to perform any work or service (esp. for government or other public body) at a certain price or rate.

children.name: Criminal group
children.label: Criminal group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons who attempt to profit by violating the law.

children.name: Displaced person group
children.label: Displaced person group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons removed from their home country by military or political pressure.

children.name: Educational group
children.label: Educational group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that provides labour and material for the educational process.

children.name: Financial group
children.label: Financial group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that provides finance, financial advice and guidance, support for the procurement process, providing pay and disbursing support.

children.name: Foreign fighters group
children.label: Foreign fighters group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that consists of fighters who are not from the country in which the fighting is taking place supporting belligerents or irregular forces.

children.name: Gang group
children.label: Gang group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons that go together or act in concert.

children.name: Insurgent group
children.label: Insurgent group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that rises in revolt against authority.

children.name: Intellectual group
children.label: Intellectual group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises intellectual beings possessing superior powers of intellect.

children.name: Intelligence group
children.label: Intelligence group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that is employed to gather information.

children.name: Internally displaced person group
children.label: Internally displaced person group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons who, as part of a mass movement, have been forced to flee their homes or place of habitual residence suddenly or unexpectedly as a result of armed conflict, internal strife, systematic violation of human rights, fear of such violation, or natural or manmade disasters, and have not crossed an internationally recognized State border.

children.name: Journalist group
children.label: Journalist group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons that earn their living by editing or writing for a public journal.

children.name: Judicial group
children.label: Judicial group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that provides judgment in courts of justice or the administration of justice.

children.name: Landowner group
children.label: Landowner group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons that are owners or proprietors of land.

children.name: Local inhabitant group
children.label: Local inhabitant group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation of a particular place regarded with reference to that place.

children.name: Medical group
children.label: Medical group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that provides a medical service.

children.name: Merchant group
children.label: Merchant group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons whose occupation is the purchase and sale of marketable commodities for profit.

children.name: Police chief group
children.label: Police chief group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons that have the responsibility for the regulation, discipline, and control of a community for the enforcement of law and public order.

children.name: Police group
children.label: Police group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that is responsible for the regulation, discipline and control of community, civil administration; enforcement of the law; public order.

children.name: Political group
children.label: Political group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that is identified as being involved within a political area of activity and concerned with politics or has ties to a political party.

children.name: Prisoner group
children.label: Prisoner group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation in custody on a criminal charge and on trial.

children.name: Prisoner of war group
children.label: Prisoner of war group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons that have fallen in the hands of or surrendered to an opponent.

children.name: Refugee group
children.label: Refugee group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons who, owing to religious persecution or political troubles, seek refuge.

children.name: Shura group
children.label: Shura group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that is an Islamic consultative council or similar advisory body.

children.name: Social group
children.label: Social group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that promotes and is characterised by friendly companionship or relations between its members.

children.name: Terrorist group
children.label: Terrorist group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons that attempt to further their views by a system of coercive intimidation.

children.name: Tribal group
children.label: Tribal group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation consisting of a number of families, clans, or other groups who share a common ancestry and culture.

children.name: Village elder group
children.label: Village elder group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons that are of ripe years and experience whose counsel is therefore sought and valued.

children.name: Writer group
children.label: Writer group
children.description: A GroupOrganisation that comprises persons that practice or perform writing.

children.name: Government facility
children.label: Government facility
children.description: A facility designed to support services that are the exclusive prerogative of the authority governing a country, or state, or division thereof.

children.name: Civilian military coordination centre
children.label: Civilian military coordination centre
children.description: Facility supporting coordination between civilian authorities/actors and military forces.

children.name: Government building
children.label: Government building
children.description: Building used to house governmental departments, agencies, or services.

children.name: Governmental leadership
children.label: Governmental leadership
children.description: Facility associated with the leadership of a government (executive, cabinet, or equivalent leadership hubs).

children.name: Headquarters facility
children.label: Headquarters facility
children.description: Facility serving as a headquarters for a governmental body or related command/administrative entity.

children.name: Law enforcement facility
children.label: Law enforcement facility
children.description: Facility used by law enforcement organizations to conduct policing, security, or judicial support functions.

children.name: Police check point
children.label: Police check point
children.description: Law-enforcement position established to control/inspect traffic and persons at a specific location.

children.name: Police station
children.label: Police station
children.description: Facility serving as a base of operations for police units, including public service desks, custody, and administrative functions.

children.name: Town hall
children.label: Town hall
children.description: Municipal government facility housing local administration and public services.

children.name: Civilian post
children.label: Civilian post
children.description: An Organisation with a set of duties that are intended to be fulfilled by one person in private sector and non-military government organisations.

children.name: Organisation
children.label: Organisation
children.description: An administrative or functional structure.
children.info: An Organisation is constituted to accomplish an aim, purpose, or mission.

children.name: Civilian type vehicle
children.label: Civilian type vehicle
children.description: A Vehicle primarily designed for civilian purposes.

children.name: Land vehicle
children.label: Land vehicle
children.description: A vehicle that is designed to operate on the ground.

children.name: Geographic feature
children.label: Geographic feature
children.description: Terrain characteristics of military significance. Remarks: A GeographicFeature is a permanent or durable natural feature. In general, it represents any natural object or configuration of ground or water represented on a map or chart.

children.name: Coastal zone
children.label: Coastal zone
children.description: Littoral areas where land and sea interact (shorelines, beaches, estuaries, deltas) critical for amphibious operations and area denial.
children.info: Consolidation vs. MIM: Maps MIM 'coastal hydrographic feature' to a single operational bucket. Fine-grained coastal forms (beach, cliff, estuary) are retained as instance categories.

children.name: Cryosphere
children.label: Cryosphere
children.description: Snow and ice environments (glaciers, pack ice, snowfields) that constrain movement, logistics, and signatures.
children.info: Alignment with MIM: Equivalent to MIM 'snow ice feature' but generalized into a single operational bucket for planning and mobility analysis.

children.name: Inland water
children.label: Inland water
children.description: Non-coastal water bodies and flows (rivers, lakes, reservoirs, canals) that affect mobility, bridging, and supply.
children.info: Alignment with MIM: Equivalent to MIM 'inland water'. Wetlands can be modeled either as a separate class (see Wetland) or as an instance category under Inland water when coastal influence is absent.

children.name: Land terrain
children.label: Land terrain
children.description: Terrestrial surfaces relevant to maneuver, observation, and sustainment (e.g., plains, hills, mountains, deserts).
children.info: Consolidation vs. MIM: Groups MIM 'landform' and also absorbs 'continent' (treated as a meta-geographic container when needed). We keep detailed relief types at instance level (e.g., category = mountain/ridge/plateau) to avoid class proliferation.

children.name: Maritime water
children.label: Maritime water
children.description: Open sea and ocean waters beyond the immediate coastal zone, relevant for sea control, SLOC protection, and maritime maneuver.
children.info: Comparison to MIM: Not explicitly separated in MIMs top list; introduced here to distinguish open-water operations from coastal/littoral features.

children.name: Wetland
children.label: Wetland
children.description: Areas with water-saturated soils (marshes, swamps, bogs) that significantly affect maneuver, concealment, and engineering tasks.
children.info: Alignment with MIM: Keeps MIM 'wetland' as its own class due to its distinct impact on mobility. When wetlands are clearly coastal, they may be typed as Wetland with an additional instance category indicating littoral context.

children.name: Command post facility
children.label: Command post facility
children.description: Facility used to host a command post (CP) and associated C2 services.

children.name: Industrial facility
children.label: Industrial facility
children.description: A facility designed to enable or support industrial business processes.

children.name: Commercial manufacturing facility
children.label: Commercial manufacturing facility
children.description: Civilian/market-oriented manufacturing or processing plants, including shipbuilding when not defense-dedicated.
children.info: Consolidates MIM: 'equipment manufacture', 'industrial works', 'processing facility' (non-energy), 'general motor vehicle production complex', 'shipyard' (civilian). 'chemical production complex' belongs here unless explicitly petrochemical (then Energy industry).

children.name: Energy industry facility
children.label: Energy industry facility
children.description: Industrial facility devoted to petroleum and petrochemical transformation/production with strategic economic relevance.
children.info: Consolidates MIM: 'petroleum production complex', 'petrochemical refinery'. If 'processing facility' refers to hydrocarbons in your dataset, treat it here; otherwise keep under Commercial manufacturing.

children.name: Extraction facility
children.label: Extraction facility
children.description: Primary extraction or mining installations providing raw materials.
children.info: Consolidates MIM: 'mining installation'.

children.name: Maintenance & repair facility
children.label: Maintenance & repair facility
children.description: Industrial sites dedicated to maintenance, overhaul, and repair of platforms and infrastructure.
children.info: Consolidates MIM: 'maintenance facility' (+ 'aircraft maintenance facility', 'motor vehicle maintenance facility'), 'repair rail facility'. Shipyard repair activities may be represented at instance level if needed.

children.name: Military manufacturing facility
children.label: Military manufacturing facility
children.description: Defense-oriented production plants for weapons, munitions, platforms, or military-configured vehicles/aircraft/ships.
children.info: Consolidates MIM: 'military production facility', 'munitions complex'. Also classify here instances of 'aircraft production complex', 'general motor vehicle production complex', or 'shipyard' when output is military; otherwise keep them under Commercial manufacturing.

children.name: Research & technology facility
children.label: Research & technology facility
children.description: Industrial/technology sites focused on research, development, testing, and high-tech capabilities.
children.info: Consolidates MIM: 'technological research facility', 'service research or utility facility', 'high technology complex'.

children.name: Consumable materiel
children.label: Consumable materiel
children.description: An expendable supply.
children.info: Consumables are meant to be used up in the normal conduct of operations other than through attrition. They can generally be issued in different standard quantities, each having its own packaging.

children.name: Materiel
children.label: Materiel
children.description: An apparatus, equipment or supply of military interest without distinction as to its application for administrative or combat purposes.

children.name: Tactical data link
children.label: Tactical data link
children.description: One or more data links organised within a given architecture and supporting a standard set of binary messages exchanged between users of that system, for use in military operations.

children.name: Data transfer
children.label: Data transfer
children.description: A service for the electronic transfer of data.

children.name: ICT service
children.label: ICT service
children.description: The performance of work in the domain of information and/or communications technology.

children.name: Message handling service
children.label: Message handling service
children.description: An application service that provides a generalised facility for exchanging electronic messages between systems.

children.name: Equipment
children.label: Equipment
children.description: Materiel that is neither intended for consumption nor an unexploded piece of ordnance.
children.info: Expressed in another way, Equipment is a durable good and not intended for consumption.

children.name: Facsimile
children.label: Facsimile
children.description: A service provided by means of electronic scanning of a document, transmitting it as data by telecommunications links, and producing an exact copy at the receiver.

children.name: Government organisation
children.label: Government organisation
children.description: An Organisation that controls and administers public policy either under a national or international mandate.

children.name: Internal security forces organisation
children.label: Internal security forces organisation
children.description: A GovernmentOrganisation whose principal designation is to keep peace within the borders of a sovereign state or other self-governing territories, generally by upholding the national law and defending against internal security threats.

children.name: International civil governmental organisation
children.label: International civil governmental organisation
children.description: A GovernmentOrganisation that is officially involved in international civil affairs.

children.name: International civil or military governmental organisation
children.label: International civil or military governmental organisation
children.description: A GovernmentOrganisation that is officially involved in international affairs that include both civil and military elements.

children.name: Military organisation
children.label: Military organisation
children.description: A GovernmentOrganisation that is officially sanctioned and is trained and equipped to exert force.

children.name: Military post
children.label: Military post
children.description: A MilitaryOrganisation with a set of duties that can be fulfilled by one person.

children.name: Unit
children.label: Unit
children.description: A MilitaryOrganisation whose structure is prescribed by competent authority.
children.info:
The structure is prescribed, e.g., in the form of a table of organisation and equipment; specifically, part of an organisation. A formation is specified as a Unit.
One aim of Unit is to permit unique specification of tables of organisation and equipment (referred to in this model as Establishment) for any unit of interest within the scope of the model. A second aim is to provide information that is necessary for generating unit symbology for situation displays.

Each nation has a different way of classifying its own units. The model supports the representation of as many types of Units as possible (within the constraints of common sense). It should be recognised that the manner of classifying units may not correspond to national classification policy. However, national implementations of external displays for operational users can (and should) be built to support the national doctrine and naming conventions. The internal classification within a C2 application (based on the model) can be entirely invisible to the user of that application.

children.name: Combat service support unit
children.label: Combat service support unit
children.description: A Unit tasked to provide support to combat forces, primarily in the fields of administration and logistics.

children.name: Combat support unit
children.label: Combat support unit
children.description: A Unit that provides critical combat functions in conjunction with combat arms units and soldiers.

children.name: Combat unit
children.label: Combat unit
children.description: A Unit who closes with and destroys enemy forces or provides firepower and destructive capabilities in the battlespace.

children.name: Command support unit
children.label: Command support unit
children.description: A Unit that provides command support elements to assist commanders in the exercise of command.

children.name: Observer unit
children.label: Observer unit
children.description: A Unit whose primary function is to perform observations.

children.name: Special operations forces unit
children.label: Special operations forces unit
children.description: A Unit that provides unique capabilities of special reconnaissance, direct action and military assistance in order to undertake difficult, dangerous and sometimes politically sensitive missions for the theatre commander.

children.name: National civil governmental organisation
children.label: National civil governmental organisation
children.description: A GovernmentOrganisation that is officially involved in national civil affairs.

children.name: Identification friend or foe
children.label: Identification friend or foe
children.description: A service for distinguishing friendly from enemy forces. This service is typically provided by a system using electromagnetic transmissions to which equipment carried by friendly forces automatically responds, for example, by emitting pulses.

children.name: Image
children.label: Image
children.description: An imagery product.

children.name: Information resource
children.label: Information resource
children.description: An Object that conveys meaning and which is broadly conceived as 'document'.
children.info: This concept includes the full range of web resources (video, images, web pages, etc.) and physical resources such as books and objects like artworks.

children.name: Image service
children.label: Image service
children.description: A service for electronic transfer of static or slowly refreshed images.

children.name: MIP31 service
children.label: MIP31 service
children.description: A MIPGatewayService based on MIP Baseline 3.1.

children.name: MIP4 iesservice
children.label: MIP4 iesservice
children.description: A service defined by the MIP 4 Information Exchange Specification.

children.name: Medical facility
children.label: Medical facility
children.description: A Facility used for treating illnesses and injuries.

children.name: Military
children.label: Military
children.description: A person who serves in the regular armed forces of a state, subject to military law and organization.

children.name: Military type vehicle
children.label: Military type vehicle
children.description: A Vehicle primarily designed for military purposes.

children.name: Other facility
children.label: Other facility
children.description: A Facility for which no further information is given other than its category.

children.name: Paramilitary
children.label: Paramilitary
children.description: A person who belongs to a non-regular armed organization with military structure or functions (e.g., militias, gendarmerie, irregular forces), typically outside the standing armed forces.

children.name: Private sector organisation
children.label: Private sector organisation
children.description: An Organisation that is a non-government organisation and is constituted for business, commerce, manufacturing, trade, relief or philanthropy.

children.name: Sensor
children.label: Sensor
children.description: A device that detects or measures a physical property and records, indicates, or otherwise responds to it.

children.name: Spacecraft
children.label: Spacecraft
children.description: A Vehicle that is capable of operating beyond the earth's atmosphere.

children.name: Tool
children.description: An instrument with which some operation is performed; a means of effecting something.
children.label: Tool

children.name: Unexploded ordnance
children.label: Unexploded ordnance
children.description: An explosive ordnance that has been primed, fused, armed, or otherwise prepared for action, and which has been fired, dropped, launched, placed in such a manner, as to constitute a hazard to operation, and remains unexploded either by malfunction or for any other cause. It is commonly abbreviated as UXO.

children.name: Vessel
children.label: Vessel
children.description: A Vehicle that is designed to operate on or under the water surface.

children.name: Video service
children.label: Video service
children.description: A service for electronic transfer of video information.

children.name: Voice service
children.label: Voice service
children.description: A service for electronic transfer of voice information.

children.name: Weapon
children.label: Weapon
children.description: Equipment of any kind used in warfare or combat to attack and overcome an enemy.
